image.altText: Man in suit speaks at podium

props.synopsis: Gautam Adani, the Indian billionaire behind Queensland's controversial Carmichael coal project, is charged in the US over an alleged multi-billion-dollar fraud scheme.

title.children: US authorities issue arrest warrant for billionaire Adani boss

image.altText: An illustration shows a pregnant woman sitting cross-legged while a woman with halo leans down to touch her belly

props.synopsis: They check the baby's position and listen to the heartbeat, but they aren't qualified midwives. Parents say a "dangerous" new breed of birth worker has emerged to fill the gap for women wanting to birth outside hospital.

title.children: 'Sovereign midwife' who thought baby's shoulder was a head linked to three baby deaths

image.altText: Donald Trump looks sideways while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: The next eight weeks leading up to Donald Trump's January 20 inauguration will be both dangerous and decisive in terms of the future of the Ukraine war.

title.children: This could be the final phase of the Ukraine war — and we're starting to see the 'Trump factor' kick in

image.altText: Coles and Woolworths branding outside neighbouring supermarkets

props.synopsis: Coles is fronting the ACCC's supermarket inquiry as hundreds of Woolworths warehouse workers are striking over pay and safety conditions, while the ASX is trading higher. Follow live.

title.children: Coles faces ACCC grilling as Woolworths workers strike, ASX higher after Wall Street slips

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: MinRes AGM kicks off in Perth as shareholders vent anger
Amazon is 'disruptive' and gaining market share in groceries
Westpac changes rates forecast, pushes first cut back to May

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a US citizen is the third person to die after a suspected methanol poisoning at a bar in the tourist town of Vang Vieng in Laos last Tuesday.

title.children: Third person dies of suspected methanol poisoning in Laos as two Australians fight for lives

image.altText: A group of the wiggles

props.synopsis: Kids under 16 will still be allowed to use YouTube, messaging apps and gaming services, under a federal government proposal to ban young people from social media. Follow live.

title.children: Teachers and The Wiggles lobby for YouTube carve out in social media ban

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer smiles, wearing a collared shirt and black jacket

props.synopsis: After 18 months and 14 doses of revolutionary experimental treatment, Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer gives an update on his latest brain scan, cautioning that these results "could just be luck".

title.children: 'Blown away I'm still here': Richard Scolyer still cancer-free 18 months into revolutionary treatment

image.altText: Close up photo of young woman with red hair, eyebrow and nose piercings

props.synopsis: The family of 19-year-old Isla Bell say they are trying to process the "unimaginable" after her remains were believed to have been found at a Melbourne tip.

title.children: 'Her hopes and dreams have been taken away': Isla Bell's family grieves after men charged over her death

image.altText: Cars with graffiti and words sprayed on them

props.synopsis: Local Liberal MP Kellie Sloane said the incident has left the Jewish community in Woollahra feeling vulnerable and scared.

title.children: 'Deeply troubling': Vandals spray anti-Israel graffiti and set car on fire in Sydney's east

image.altText: A man speaking into a microphone, seen from close up

props.synopsis: Billionaires are playing an increasing role in US politics, and while some are very visible, several legal rulings have paved the way for other mega-wealthy donors to splash their cash and cover their tracks.

title.children: 'Broligarchs' now run the US, and their dark money is hard to trace

image.altText: A silhouette of a pregnant woman outside.

props.synopsis: A new report shows only 6 per cent of child protection funding goes to Aboriginal-run organisations, despite these groups often posting better outcomes.

title.children: First Nations children are being removed from families at highest levels ever recorded

image.altText: A man getting on a bus.

props.synopsis: From Friday morning, trains across and into Sydney will come to a halt. The NSW government has said there will be some new measures to help address demand, but what exactly will they be?

title.children: What we do and don't know about public transport services during the Sydney rail shutdown

image.altText: Three women wearing green, blue and red saris sew at sewing machines in a line.

props.synopsis: The fast fashion giant behind Millers, Rivers and Katies has left factories in Bangladesh scrambling for reportedly more than $30 million in unpaid invoices — and the fallout threatens the livelihoods of thousands of women.

title.children: Garment workers fear their children will go hungry after Australian fast fashion brand's collapse

image.altText: mid shot of man wearing glasses and suit with plane in background

props.synopsis: Albanese's consistency on trade and calls to stick with the Paris climate agreement suggest he's not scared of taking a different policy path to Donald Trump. That doesn't mean navigating the path ahead will be easy.

title.children: Albanese never said his name, but an awkward moment sums up why an absent Trump was the talk of Rio

image.altText: two chinese men standing next to each other with their faces blurred

props.synopsis: An Indigenous ranger group that rescued four asylum seekers on a remote island off the Northern Territory coast last week is calling for the federal government to guarantee their safety.

title.children: 'He said if he's sent back to China, he'll be killed': Rangers question future of asylum seekers found in remote NT

image.altText: Namila Benson, with flowing black dress and bright auburn hair, smiles widely surrounded by shrubs and a path.

props.synopsis: On Thursday, the ABC announced its content slate for 2025, across broadcast and digital platforms, including six arts series.

title.children: ABC announces broadcasting plans for 2025 with focus on the arts

image.altText: A man and a woman, both wearing suit jackets.

props.synopsis: Australia's $230 billion sovereign wealth fund would retain its focus on making a return, and the government has pledged not to draw down on it for eight years.

title.children: Government directs $230 billion Future Fund to invest in housing and green energy

image.altText: banana duct taped to a white wall

props.synopsis: A piece of conceptual art consisting of a banana duct-taped to a wall has sold for $US6.2 million ($9.57 million) at an auction in New York.

title.children: Duct-taped banana artwork Comedian sells for nearly $10 million

image.altText: A Woolworths logo in Adelaide's Rundle Mall

props.synopsis: The supermarket giant told Australia's competition watchdog its competition went far beyond Coles, Aldi, and Costco, and that it was spending millions on its online offerings to prepare with Amazon as an emerging competitor.

title.children: Woolworths spends millions as emerging competitor Amazon encroaches on similar products

image.altText: Cody Simpson and his Guys and Dolls co-stars Jason Arrow and Bobby Fox on Sydney Harbour

props.synopsis: Australian pop star and former competitive swimmer Cody Simpson is returning to performing in a new production of Guys & Dolls in Sydney.

title.children: Cody Simpson is back — and says swimming has made him a better singer

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: MPs from both sides of politics ask about proposed laws to re-detain people released from immigration detention by the High Court, saying they could limit as many as 10 separate human rights.

title.children: Bill to re-detain NZYQ cohort may impinge on 10 separate human rights

image.altText: A woman covers her face with her hand as she appears on a video call

props.synopsis: Susan Smith said her sons had been abducted by a black man, before confessing to killing both of them after nine days of searching.

title.children: 'That's only 15 years per child': Mother who killed toddler sons in 1994 murder denied bail after 30 years behind bars

image.altText: Woman with dark curly shoulder length hair and light brown skin sits in front of a laptop in an office late at night

props.synopsis: The latest report predicts rapid growth in the clean energy workforce, science industry and healthcare and disability sector.

title.children: Some of the jobs of the future are only just emerging, and they don't all need a uni degree

image.altText: A man observes a cruise missile on display

props.synopsis: The reports in British media come after US-supplied long-range missiles were reportedly used for the first time on Russian soil.

title.children: Ukraine fires UK-supplied Storm Shadow missiles at targets inside Russia for first time

image.altText: A sheikh delivering a televised address in front of a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: Israel and Hezbollah appear unwilling to compromise on how a proposed ceasefire deal between the two sides would be enforced, with the Israeli government saying it wants "the freedom to act" within Lebanon.

title.children: Hezbollah vows retaliation in Tel Aviv as sticking point holds up truce negotiations

image.altText: A woman covers her face with her hand as she appears on a video call

props.synopsis: Susan Smith said her sons had been abducted by a black man, before confessing to killing both of them after nine days of searching.

title.children: 'That's only 15 years per child': Mother who killed toddler sons in 1994 murder denied bail after 30 years behind bars

image.altText: A woman with glasses in a suit

props.synopsis: The first openly transgender member elected to the US House of Representatives Sarah McBride says she is "not here to fight about bathrooms" in response to the Republican bill aimed at restricting transgender people from bathrooms on Capitol Hill.

title.children: First openly transgender member of Congress responds to Capitol bathrooms' 'biological sex' ruling

image.altText: A black and white photo of Liam Payne is stuck to a pole with the words 'rest in peace' written on it

props.synopsis: The family and friends of the late One Direction star came together at a small service outside of London to farewell Liam Payne, who died last month.

title.children: Liam Payne farewelled by One Direction bandmates, stars and family at funeral

image.altText: Four cocktail glasses are raised to touch in a cheers gesture over a table

props.synopsis: The research findings are adding to the emerging evidence of how personal data is mined when we simply look at, shop on an alcohol retailer's website, or even use things like loyalty cards.

title.children: Alcohol companies' digital marketing targets problem drinkers, research finds

image.altText: A close up of Sararat Rangsiwuthaporn's standing in front of a sign indicating her height.

props.synopsis: A woman dubbed "Am Cyanide" by Thai media has faced her first of 14 murder trials involving alleged cyanide poisonings.

title.children: Thai woman accused of murdering 14 friends with cyanide given death penalty

image.altText: a black and white ship with chinese writing in the ocean

props.synopsis: Investigations have started after two underwater telecommunication cables were cut in the Baltic Sea in a possible act of "sabotage," according to European authorities.

title.children: Russia rejects claims of sabotage on undersea cables in Europe, Danish military monitors Chinese ship

image.altText: A road with palm trees along the side, and blue sky.

props.synopsis: Pacific aid dropped sharply as COVID support ended, while China has re-emerged as the second largest donor in the region.

title.children: China becomes second largest provider of aid to the Pacific, new analysis shows

image.altText: Two women look into an elaborate mirror

props.synopsis: After more than 20 years of raging success on stage, the origin story of the Wicked Witch of the West has finally made it to the big screen. And the lush, visual spectacular does not disappoint.

title.children: Ariana Grande brings her skilful falsetto and superb comedic timing to the world of Wicked
